qas.question: Where are infrared LEDs used in everday life?
How are LEDs used in theaters?

answers.text: to send sound to listeners' receivers

qas.question: LEDs can send data over what type of cable?
What type of fiber forms the backbone of the internet?
Where are infrared non-LEDs used in everyday life?

plausible_answers.text: to send sound to listeners' receivers

qas.question: How are non-LEDs used in theaters?
LEDs can't send data over what type of cable?
What type of fiber doesn't form the backbone of the internet?

context: Assistive listening devices in many <a0_0><b4_0>theaters<b4_0/><a0_0/> and similar spaces use arrays of infrared LEDs <a1_0><b5_0>to send sound to listeners' receivers<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Light-emitting diodes (as well as semiconductor lasers) are used to send data over many types of <a2_0><b6_0>fiber optic<b6_0/><a2_0/> cable, from digital audio over TOSLINK cables to the <a3_0><b7_0>very high bandwidth<b7_0/><a3_0/> fiber links that form the Internet backbone. For some time, computers were commonly equipped with IrDA interfaces, which allowed them to send and receive data to nearby machines via infrared.
